context_evidences: - Minutes after Bosa had tweeted the video as fact, netizens began pointing out the obvious. For a couple of hours, CNBC maintained that they were trying to verify the video with Twitter, but existing Twitter employees were calling them out in the comments for reporting the hoax as truth. Reference: https://dailyhive.com/vancouver/twitter-hoax-employees-laid-off-elon-musk published on 2022-10-28 21:24:20

- “Ligma” refers to an internet meme that follows the same wordplay principle as, say, “nunya business,” “deez nuts,” or “updog” (“what’s updog?”). The meme has been around for several years, and this Urban Dictionary entry from 2018 might illustrate how it works if you need clarity. Reference: https://dailyhive.com/vancouver/twitter-hoax-employees-laid-off-elon-musk published on 2022-10-28 21:24:20

- One gave his name as Rahul Ligma. Fans of internet memes would have recognized the monicker, which is a set-up for a vulgar joke that circulated on Twitter. The other was Daniel Johnson, at least during the interview. Reference: https://deadline.com/2022/10/fake-news-media-outlets-pranked-bogus-twitter-employees-laments-1235158146/ published on 2022-10-28 23:31:08

- Media outlets hungry for a sob story leaped on it, with the usually reliable Bloomberg running headlines of employees leaving Twitter with boxes in hand. Reference: https://deadline.com/2022/10/fake-news-media-outlets-pranked-bogus-twitter-employees-laments-1235158146/ published on 2022-10-28 23:31:08
correction_response:
This tweet is potentially misleading. "Ligma" and "Johnson" refer to a hoax where two individuals pretended to be laid-off Twitter employees. The names are part of an internet meme and a setup for a vulgar joke. Elon Musk's tweet seems to be a continuation of this joke, not an announcement of actual individuals returning to a position. 
https://dailyhive.com/vancouver/twitter-hoax-employees-laid-off-elon-musk
https://deadline.com/2022/10/fake-news-media-outlets-pranked-bogus-twitter-employees-laments-1235158146/
note_1_text: This is satire.  Mr Ligma and Mr Johnson were not ever twitter employees, they are comedians who took advantage of the wild speculation around Twitter layoffs.    https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/technology/two-dudes-pretending-to-be-fired-twitter-employees-pull-off-one-of-the-best-ligma-jokes-of-all-time-trolling-media/ar-AA13ursO
note_2_text: These people were not employees at Twitter. They were pulling a prank by carrying boxes near Twitter headquarters and were subsequently interviewed by news orgs as if they were employees. Elon is playing a joke at the expense of the thousands of twitter employees he laid off. https://deadline.com/2022/10/fake-news-media-outlets-pranked-bogus-twitter-employees-laments-1235158146/
queries:
1. "Ligma & Johnson return"
2. "Ligma & Johnson recent activities"
3. "Ligma & Johnson social media logo"
4. "Latest news about Ligma & Johnson"
5. "Who are Ligma & Johnson"
refute_evidences: - The Verge took a look at Twitter’s Slack directory and did not find anyone by that name. An employee as such does not exist on LinkedIn either, which should’ve been sufficient confirmation. Reference: https://dailyhive.com/vancouver/twitter-hoax-employees-laid-off-elon-musk published on 2022-10-28 21:24:20

- Two individuals decided to take the opportunity to troll the world by pretending they were engineers at Twitter and were leaving their office in classic “you’re fired” fashion – cardboard boxes, stressed-out faces, the whole nine yards. Reference: https://dailyhive.com/vancouver/twitter-hoax-employees-laid-off-elon-musk published on 2022-10-28 21:24:20

- Two men carrying cardboard boxes were interviewed outside the Twitter offices today, bemoaning their fate as laid-off victims of new owner Elon Musk ’s promised purge. Reference: https://deadline.com/2022/10/fake-news-media-outlets-pranked-bogus-twitter-employees-laments-1235158146/ published on 2022-10-28 23:31:08

- Elon Musk himself got in on the fun. “Ligma Johnson had it coming,” he tweeted. Reference: https://deadline.com/2022/10/fake-news-media-outlets-pranked-bogus-twitter-employees-laments-1235158146/ published on 2022-10-28 23:31:08
